ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Tranix Crown Disappointment.....
ygData.msgSnippet: I m in complete agreement with Syl on this issue. If you are going on a raid, and want to be considered for loot (who wouldn t?) I would definitely get info on
ygData.messageBody:
I'm in complete agreement with Syl on this issue. If you are going on a
raid, and want to be considered for loot (who wouldn't?) I would definitely
get info on how it will be done before going. The only problem with this is
on Veeshan, FG's tend to be spur of the moment with people racing to kill
them when they are found to be alive. Basically, on our server FG's usually
don't last much longer than an hour or two after they have popped(depending
on the efficiency of the raiders).

Bards should be a primary consideration for this item IMO, though I think
enchanters should get dibs on it. Monks - definitely. Then anyone else. I
hear necros need CHA. For what I'm not exactly sure (my friend told me, but
I forget).

Bottom line, Madagan - If you are in a pick up group situation on any raid
find out how loot will be distributed. Since half the raids on Veeshan are
mixed group/guild/pick-up group-based, I think randoming works out fine.
What you need to find out is who will be allowed to roll for what. I heard
bards were passed over for the last Orb of Tishani in rolling with only
casters allowed to /random. Total B.S. if you ask me...Though I only do
raids with my guild, and everything is pre-determined on who gets what, I'd
love to find out made that decision to oust the bard in favor of the
enchanter on your FG raid... =)

Sartori D'Elsiraad<Legion>
50th Bard of Veeshan

>From: "Sylly Songsynger" <jgs@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@egroups.com
>To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Tranix Crown Disappointment.....
>Date: Thu, 13 Apr 2000 09:57:20 -0500
>
>People should discuss Loot Rules *before* you start the raid so that
>*everyone* understands how loot will be distributed:
>
>all random on all items
>
>some guru decides who gets what or who gets to roll for what
>
>alpha loot - splits off (double a's go last) heh, been a while since
>HighKeep?
>
>Especially pick-up groups. Why go if you wont get paid? In a pick-up
>group, I believe that everyone should be allowed to roll for any item they
>want. Also, if stated ahead of time, once you win a roll, you dont roll
>until every one wins something. Thats for pickup groups. In my guild
>groups, we go by our guild policy which is based on highest and best use of
>items, etc. and GM or raid leader has final say
> http://pantheon.worldshock.com/articles/looting/index.htm ). I think
>Miriana posted that link before but there it is again. I am sure there are
>other good loot schemes but to me the most important factor is knowing what
>the rules are before you play the game. Do not go on those stoopid pick-up
>raids unless you have a clear understand of how loot will be distributed -
>ahead of time.
>
>Sylly
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: <John_Senior@...>
>To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 10:04 AM
>Subject: [eqbards] Tranix Crown Disappointment.....
>
>
> > Last night on Veeshan a few members from 3-4 guilds participated in a
>Fire
> > Giant run,
>
> > I just thought I would post this here and see whether you guys and girls
> > think I should of got to roll for this item?
>
>
